text: A perky young WAITRESS stands over him, holding a pot of coffee.
Warm-up?
On cris Young again.
Just the check.
She sets it on the table with a flirtatious smile. He tak it to the register and pays cash. Cris (V.O.) "The future ain't what it used to be." Ever hear that expression?
A moment later, A SECOND CRIS follows the first Cris to t register, repeating his every movement.
It's a joke, but it's true. The future changes every time you look at it. Because you looked at it.
As Cris 2 pays cash, Cris 1 proceeds into the casino.
Cause once you see it, you're different.
Cris 2 follows, literally walking in Cris 1's footsteps.
Maybe just a little.
A DRUNK bumps into Cris 1 and spills his Daiquiri on him.
And that changes everything else.
Cris 2 -- the real Cris -- follows a moment later and sidesteps the Drunk, who spills his Daiquiri on someone e
It's got something to do with quantum physics.

Cris 2 reaches the gaming tables and merges with Cris 1. Cris (V.O.) That's why I stay away from roulette and craps. It only takes a millionth of an ounce to change a roll. Just placing a different bet can throw things off.
A roulette ball skitters indecisively between two grooves before settling into one of them. CRIS (v.O.) I've got other rules, too. I don't play against people, like at poker. Only against the house.
Slot machines. Horse racing. Sports games. CRIS (v.o.) And my goal isn't to win big. At least not any more. The idea is to go unnoticed so I can keep coming back to the trough.
He passes the MILLION DOLLAR SLOT. Stops, like it's calli out to him.
CRIS (v.o.) So no jackpots. No longshots. No big bets except when I want `em to see me lose.
Cris notices a DESPERATE GAMBLER on the verge of tears. Clearly, he's dropped a bundle. Cris approaches him and points to the MILLION DOLLAR SLOT.
Try that one, man. I've got a feeling. Gambler (suspicious) Then you play it.
Against my religion.
Cris offers the guy a handful of silver dollars.
Do it, quick, before somebody else gets there.

While the Gambler dawdles, a MIDWESTERN DOWAGER plants herself at the MEGA-SLOT and starts feeding it dollars. Cris sighs and walks off. The Gambler watches him go, then reacts to BELLS, FLASHIN LIGHTS, and SHRIEKS OF CELEBRATION. The Dowager has hit t MEGA-JACKPOT. Blackjack section Cris takes a stool at a crowded table.
Mainly I stick to blackjack. Boring but controllable.
Cris antes up. Cards are dealt. He's got a four showing. Taking a hit, he goes bust with a jack. So in real time, sticks.
And safe unless they think you're counting.
The dealer turns over his cards. He's got a king and a de So he has to draw. Pulls the jack. Busted. The dealer pays Cris, then presses a button under the tab

Banks of video monitors display images from the multitude cameras looking down from above the gaming tables. The SURVEILLANCE SUPERVISOR, HAWKEYE, repositions in response a red light so he can look over a Surveillance Operator's shoulder and study Cris. INT. office of casino boss - DIFFERENT CASINO - DAY The Stalin-faced CASINO BOSS sits behind his desk. casino boss If you don't mind my asking, why does Homeland Security give a damn about who's lucky in Vegas?

He's talking to Callie Ferris. We recognize her sardonic beauty from the plasma screen in Cris's pre-vision. In person, she's edgy, confident, and impatient with those w aren't as quick as she is. Ferris Maybe they're more than lucky. casino boss Then we handle it. Ferris I'm not talking about cheating. That's your problem. But if somebody wins consistently and you can't figure out how...Excuse me.
She answers her cell phone. Ferris Ferris...I'll be there in fifteen.
She stands, disconnects, and hands the Casino Boss her business card.
Call me, like they did. And try to hold him till I get here.
Casino boss Yes, ma'am.

She's already out the door. Video monitor: close on cris Relaxed. Playing blackjack. The FEMALE DEALER tries not t gawk at him as she deals from a shoe. Ferris (o.c.) Nice looking guy. davis (o.c.) I guess.

Pull back: surveillance room Ferris and DAVIS, the casino's dapper CHIEF OF SECURITY, stand behind Hawkeye, the Surveillance Supervisor, and st Cris on various monitors. Ferris Maybe she's in cahoots. davis He's beaten six dealers in a row. ferriS You're sure he's not counting? hawkeye We've got five decks in the shoe. And he wins more off the top than the bottom. davis Moves a lot from table to table.
On a monitor, Cris pockets some of his chips. hawkeye Keeps his stacks short.
On another monitor, A COCKTAIL WAITRESS takes orders from players.
What's your pleasure?
Grand Dad, rocks.
Ferris What's his name? davis (shrugs) Not staying here. Pays in cash. Hawkeye We're running him through face check.

As Ferris watches Cris on the monitor, he becomes still a attentive, as if sensing danger. He squints a little, the we do when we try to remember something. Ferris Invite him for a drink. (remembers her manners) If you don't mind.
As Cris signals for another card, TWO BLACK SUITS appear behind him. black suit (o.S.) Sir, would you come with us, please.
Cris takes in their grim faces. Turns to see two more pai of goons stationed nearby. Thirty seconds ago The COCKTAIL WAITRESS approaches to take Cris' order.
What's your pleasure?
This time, Cris hurriedly scoops all his chips into his c pocket, jostling the Waitress as he stands.
Scuse me, sorry.

Hustling away, he glances back just as the first TWO BLAC SUITS reach his stool, but this time it's empty. They loo around. One of them whispers into his mike. The three pai of goons get instructions and split up.

Tracking shot / eye level Cris strides crisply through the casino. Sees another PAI BLACK SUITS, scanning for him. He ducks into the maze of slots. Zigs and zags from aisle to aisle, seemingly at random. A moment after each turn, a Black Suit appears ah behind, or to the side - where they would have spotted Cr Tracking shot / high angle A clearer perspective as TWO BLACK SUITS approach Cris' a from different directions. Cris has no way to see them or know they're coming, but at the last moment, he MOVES in between two aisles where neither guard will see him as th pass. surveillance room Davis and Hawkeye wince as the Black Suits keep missing t quarry. davis What's wrong with you guys? hawkeye He's right next to you! Aisle 63!

Ferris watches the chase, fascinated. Phalanxes of slot machines Black Suits converge from various directions, in that fak calm fast-walk. Cris studies the gamblers playing the machines nearby, th heads to a particular spot - where he is sure to be spott except that a TEXAS-SIZED MAN repositions himself, blocki the Black Suit's view. The Black Suit moves on. Cris shifts to another spot just a different Black Suit arrives at the other end of the ai This time, THREE FRAT BOYS change machines and obscure Cr from his gaze. surveillance room Davis is throwing a fit. Davis There! There! He's right there in front of you! Walk toward each other!
Cris slips away in the shadow of the Frat Boys. hawkeye Maybe he's on our frequency.
I don't see an earphone on him. hawkeye He's heading to the Convention Annex.
(stands) Give me a headset. I'm going down there.

Convention annex Arriving at the foyer, Cris sees Five Meeting Rooms. He squints then decisively enters one of them. FOUR BLACK SUITS arrive an instant later. Without wasting beat, each of them goes through a different door. All exc the one Cris went through. Cris re-emerges a moment later and heads back toward the casino. Casino Ferris, arriving, adjusts her headset. Cris sees her. Recognizes her from his prevision as the w on the plasma screen. Turns and walks away. She sees Cris. Takes off after him. Ferris (to head mic) He's heading toward... (reads sign) the Ipanema Grill.
Security Staff converge on the area. Cris is in plain sig Suddenly a busload of tourists surge in through a door an clog the way. Cris continues into the...

Kitchen area Passing a room service cart, he rolls it in front of him. few steps on, he takes the bottle of OLIVE OIL on the car and pours some in front of one random closed door. Cris t shoves the room service cart down the hall toward an empt intersecting corridor. A Black Suit barrels into the empt intersection just as the cart arrives - and tumbles over Behind Cris, a door swings open; a Black Suit charges out steps precisely into the puddle of poured olive oil - and falls on his ass. Cris slips by him, but gets cut off by an arriving group FOUR MORE BLACK SUITS. Big guys. They try to grab him. He evades their grasp almost magically and, like a Shaolin M somehow leverages them into each other until they are in pile on the floor. Cris darts around them into the... Lobby He co-opts a luggage cart that is loaded up for delivery. Rolling it to the left, a Black Suit on that side doesn't him - and moves on. Cris switches to the right side of th card - just as a second Black Suit would have seen him. Abandoning the cart, Cris sets off across the lobby in a herky-jerky rhythm. He walks four quick steps without being seen. Then stops behind a column just as Black Suit 1 turns his way. When Black Suit 1 looks on, Cris resumes his journey, cutting across the lobby at an acute angle. In this way, he avoid being seen by Black Suit 2. Cris now backs up three steps avoids being seen by Black Suit 3. By precisely choosing his movements and knowing where his hunters will be looking, Cris achieves something like invisibility. The last obstacle to daylight is Ferris. She sees him. He makes a run for the door. She dashes after him.
You! I just need to talk to you!
Cris grabs a guest's suitcase and keeps moving.
Homeland Security!

The guest chases after Cris - and collides with Ferris, knocking her to the ground. Which allows Cris to slip thr a door to the... Ext. Hotel loading dock - DAY Where TWO LAUNDRY DELIVERY MEN are flinging sacks of clot into the back of a truck. Cris steps toward the open tail with a steady pace. As if on cue, both Laundry Guys turn bend to pick up another sack of clothes. Cris walks right them without being noticed -- and climbs into the truck. moment later, the Laundry Guys pivot back around, toss sa of clothes in after Cris, and slam the rear doors. They g in the truck and drive off just as Ferris, Davis, and sev Black Suits arrive to find a cold trail. davis You were right. This guy is a lot more than lucky.
Oddly, Ferris seems almost encouraged. ferrIS At least now I know he exists.

INT. DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY - las vegas regional OFFICE - nIGHT Ferris strides purposefully through hallways crowded with people hustling just as urgently as she is. She enters th large ante-room of a bigshot's office and addresses JEANN a civil service secretary. Ferris Jeannie, I have to see him right away. Jeannie He's on with Washington. We just went on Code Orange. Ferris What's the threat?
We found a dirty bomb in East Vegas. A barrel of C-4 and a kilo of nuclear waste. But we're getting chatter about a dozen more out there somewhere, ready to blow.
Ferris absorbs the catastrophic news without emotion.
Ferris Tell him I have a new source that could help with the case.
(snide) Another remote viewer?
Ferris stares her down. Ferris Have him meet me in imaging.

Leaves without waiting for a response. ext. picnic in park - Day Cris and a glowing YOUNG MOTHER hold a BABY BOY. Gazing i the baby's eyes, Cris beams with perfect happiness. He pl with the baby's fingers. The two middle ones are subtly WEBBED BY A PIECE OF SKIN that comes about halfway up the bottom knuckle. The image whites out as...

Sunlight pours into the back of the truck, revealing Cris lounging on a mound of laundry sacks. He composes himself steps out, nonchalant as James Bond. CrIS Thanks, guys. Not too heavy on the starch.

Computer simulation The pursuit of Cris through the casino has been mapped in 3-D visualization. Multiple camera angles have been merge that a single POV seamlessly follows Cris without cutting It's clear that Cris avoids trouble before he sees it. male voice (O.s.) You pulled me out of a conference call with the Secretary to show me a video game?

INT. IMAGING lab - DAY ERIC WISDOM, 38, stands next to Ferris as they watch the simulation on a flat-screen monitor. Highly competent, solidly masculine, Spencer Tracy to her Hepburn, you can on him in your average emergency. Which this is not.
I need six men to bring him in.
We're on Code Orange. Ferris He could help us find the other bombs.
That's an ultra low probability. None of your "specials" have ever panned out, and this isn't the time to experiment.
Ferris steps close to Wisdom.
Come on, Eric, you saw it. We're flying blind and he's got radar.
Wisdom steps away from her.
Callie, people are talking. They say I'm only funding your research because we're involved. FeRRIS That's because they're....
Right.
Ouch.
I'm sorry, but they're right.
You bastard.
I care about you, and I wanted to support you. But there's a limit to what I can...
(professional) Look, we analyzed what this ability would look like if it existed.

FERRIS (cont'd) I went screening for it in a highly scientific way. And now I've identified someone who matches all the indicators. So the next obvious step is to... wisdom Let me do my job! - Christ! Don't you ever quit?
No. (beat) I've got a country to protect.
He finds her both infuriating and irresistible.
Use your charm on somebody else.
He stalks out of the room, leaving her more thwarted than sad.
An elevated freeway. Driving behind a pick-up truck carry a mattress and box spring. Cris (v.O.) I'm not God. I don't see everything. Just my own future.
Ext./INT. Cris' car - DAY Cris drives an old Camaro, muscle-y but inconspicuous. Cris (v.O.) To me, it seems normal. The way lightning comes before thunder.
Cris changes lanes to get from behind the truck.
Most of the time, I'm not paying attention. Just making sure I don't step in a mess.
In his rearview mirror, Cris sees the mattress fall off t truck, causing an accident.
Sometimes I get a blast from far away.
He sees a plume of smoke in the distance.
Or I can start with a glimpse of something close and keep pushing on.
He takes the next exit.
Usually it's none of my business.
He turns into the parking lot of a bookie shop, THE FINIS LINE. INT. The finish line - DAY Cris walks to the counter. Addresses the manager.
Guy around?
You are?
Tell him it's King Midas.
INT. homeland security regional hq - internal security of

TERRY BAINES, plainclothed HEAD OF PROTECTIVE SERVICES fo the Facility, walks down the corridor with three of the better-trained MILITARY POLICE who have been brought in t augment the regular staff of civilian FEDERAL PROTECTIVE SERVICE POLICE. Baines is a handsome former Special Force Lieutenant, early-forties, who takes his work very seriou Ferris runs to catch up with him. He doesn't slow down fo her.
Terry? Terry! - I know you've got your hands full but I was wondering if you might be able to spare a few warm bodies for an outside operation.
She gives him a look. There's some mutual attraction, but a lot of affection.
We're strictly internal.
That's why I need your people. Everybody else is assigned.
Does Wisdom know about this?
He suggested it.
While Baines arches a dubious eyebrow, an intellectual ju analyst, AMANDA, catches up with Ferris.
Callie. (corrects herself) Agent Ferris. I've got a face match on your subject. His name is Cris Johnson.
Ferris takes Amanda's PRINTOUT and glances at it on the r it's a PHOTO of Cris on a WANTED BULLETIN. fERRIS (slows to a stop) Never mind, Terry. Pretty Boy here is wanted for murder in Nevada.
She hustles off with Amanda.

location: BACK ROOM AT THE FINISH LINE

text: A smoky office with a big screen tv and a poker table, bu card players. Cris is greeted by GUY, relaxed, profession smartly dressed, mid-forties. He's classier than the join runs. Guy Well, if it isn't the Golden Man.
A look, a hug. A lot of history. Guy What brings you crawling back to me?
I need to cash some chips. - Got tagged.
He starts setting them in stacks on the poker table.
You burned through your stash already?
I've been trying to lay low.
INT. State police STATION - dAY Computer monitor on a desk plays Cris' escape from the casino. CavANAUGH (o.s.) That's him. I call him the Road Runner. You know? Beep beep.
LT. CAVANAUGH, middle-aged hunter type, beer belly but st a menace. Ferris What's he running from?
Cavanaugh takes a videocassette from a pile on his messy desk.
You showed me yours. I'll show you mine.

He pops the tape into a VCR. Presses play. On the monitor Low-quality security camera recording of a liquor store a night. Business is good. FIVE PEOPLE wait in line at the register. Time code reads November 11, 2004. Cris walks i unsteady on his feet. Heads for the beer locker. Pauses. Suddenly runs toward the register at full speed and TACKL CUSTOMER, shoving him hard to the floor. Cris prepares to hold him down, but the tackled man just lies there, a poo blood forming under his head. Cris looks up. The customer are gaping at him, terrified.
(slurred) He was gonna kill you! You all would'a died!
Cris sees that they're afraid of him, not the dead man. H runs out. PAUSE TAPE. Back to scene Cavanaugh studies Ferris' reaction.

location: BACK ROOM AT THE FINISH LINE

text: Guy finishes counting Cris' chips. Guy But you of all people. How could you have let it happen?
That was the night Donna broke off our engagement.
Ahh.
I was so drunk I could barely see now.
Guy opens a drawer, takes out a pack of a hundred $100's, counts out an additional sum from his pocket.
Well, I hope you don't mind. I called Neal to let him know you're here.
Christ, Guy, did you have to?
You say everything's inevitable, so I guess I did.
Guy returns to his antique copper espresso machine and st to make two cups.
Well, you can save your breath. Cause I know what you're gonna say.
Then you're aware that Neal is in a serious cash crunch and could lose it all.
I'm sorry to hear that. But I'm done playing the market.
While Guy is distracted making espresso, Cris jams the de drawer shut with a penny.

Neal's got it all worked out. He'll fly you out of the country on his jet. Put you up in style. He pays taxes, totally legal. You get cash, squeaky clean. Half the net. When your share hits fifty mil, you can say "finito"...and it's over.
Except last time, Neal didn't take "finito" for an answer.
Guy slams his fist.
You need us, asshole! The Law is breathin' down your neck!
I can stay ahead of `em forever.
But why live that way?
Because I don't want to be used any more.
What do you give a shit as long as you get what you want?
Cause what I want is freedom. And you don't get it by giving it up.
Guy calms himself and sets an espresso in front of Cris.
Enjoy it while it lasts.

Cris picks up the cup and knocks it back. Ext. finish line - Parking lot - DAY Cris starts up the car. Notices he's woozy. He prepares t back out. Instead he blacks out -- as Guy and THREE MEN d him out of the car.

Guy's office Guy sets the cup of espresso in front of Cris, who picks up. But Instead of knocking it back, he sets it down and grins cryptically at Guy, who senses something and reache open his top desk drawer - the one Cris pennied shut. Guy can't get it open. Guy reaches under his Racing Form. Fee around. Cris holds up a knife.
Looking for this?
Guy pulls his arm from under the Racing Form -- spilling cup of espresso that Cris just set down. Guy knows that's a coincidence.
Don't mess with somebody who knows your moves before you even think 'em.
Cris takes his cash.
The jet'll be sold in a week. Then there goes your ticket out.
Don't wait for me.
Cris heads out. Guy You know what I think? I think I know the future better than you do.
Cris scoffs as he leaves.
INT. State police STATION - dAY Cavanaugh pours coffee for himself and Ferris.
He's just some gambler. Lives completely off the grid. No bank account. No credit cards. No previous record. Ferris So why'd he do it?
Must be a wacko. He'd never met the victim. No connection whatsoever.
Ferris tries to make sense of it all. feRRIS And in fifteen months, why haven't you caught him?
Cavanaugh sighs woefully.
You saw. He's got eyes in the back of his head. He can see around corners. I even had him in custody once, and he disappeared. Ferris Must be very embarrassing.
A painful subject for Cavanaugh.
And what is it you want him for? Ferris Questioning.
About? Ferris Stuff that hasn't happened yet.
Cavanaugh nods knowingly.
Well, I guess Homeland Security trumps liquor store murder. How can I help?

Ext. Suburban home - las vegas - niGHT A tract house, cheap, from the 60's, could be anywhere. Something sad about the place. Cris stands at the door, holding a bag of groceries. IRV, a sick old man, opens th door, wearing a knit cap and pajamas. He's hooked up to a little oxygen tank on wheels. When he sees Cris, his smil crimps the tube in his nose.
What are you doing back here?
I came to fix you dinner.
Idiot.
Irv pulls Cris inside. Closes the door. INT. irv's house - night They embrace like father and son. The oxygen tube gets in way.
This is what you get from two packs a day. CrIS But you quit ten years ago.
It was already too late. I just didn't know it.
Sometimes not knowing is better.
Irv shakes his head.
Look where you're headed, pal. The big decisions are over before you even realize you made `em.
INT. The finish line - back room - night Cavanaugh and Ferris chat with Guy. This time the poker g is in progress. CaVANAUGH Any idea where he might be going?
Guy turns to Ferris.
I've got a little problem with the IRS. Think I could get some relief?
Depends how helpful you are. GuY Oh, I know everything about him.
He looks at Ferris, knowing. She turns to Cavanaugh.
I need to speak to him alone.
Guy and Ferris sip cappucino.

And another thing, no woman ever turns him down, I'm serious. Mainly because he only propositions the ones he knows'll say yes, which is most of `em anyway. But does that make him happy? No. Says he's bored. Never surprised. Has to watch himself die over and over again.
Why'd he come back to Vegas?
Didn't say, but I'm guessin' it's this friend who's dying. An old fart who took him in when he was strung out on drugs. - He's an orphan, ya know. Been on the road since he was ten.
INT. Irv's house / living room - night The place is a mess. Piles of newspapers. Old clothes. Cr cleans up as they talk. Irv sits at a table and plays solitaire.
You want my advice? Get yourself a good lawyer and turn yourself in.
If I tell `em the truth, you know what happens? I end up with the Feds. - And you know what they do to me?
Make you a secret agent. Cris Don't laugh. They strap me in a chair and make me watch the news.
Dan Rather or Peter Jennings?
It's not funny, Irv. That's all I do, day after day, for the rest of my life. Watch the news until I lose my hair and croak.
Irv is moved by Cris' dilemma. Irv There's no way around it?
The best I can do is stay away from all of `em.
Irv shakes his head with sympathy for Cris' plight.
In that case, you've gotta leave the country.
I know, I know, but there's something I gotta do first.
What?
Cris doesn't answer. His gaze is distant.
Cris?
Cris focuses.
She's coming here. The Fed.
You gotta go?
Cris thinks. Shakes his head.
Let's play it out.
INT. Irv's kitchen - DAY Cris makes a lamb roast, studding it with cloves of garli
I've got the place all picked out. It's called Palau. Three hundred teeny islands in the South Pacific. (places roast in pan) Nothing ever happens there, so there's nothing to foresee.
Then what the hell are you waiting for?
Cris puts the roasting pan in the oven.
Her.
Who?
I haven't met her yet.
Then find somebody else!
It has to be her.
What's so special about this one?
She's the mother of my child.
Irv stops shuffling the cards.
I thought you were shooting blanks.
I guess the doctors were wrong.
I don't mean to be indelicate, my friend, but how do you know the little bastard is yours?
He's got my thing.
Your thing?
Cris holds up his hand, revealing that the skin between h two middle fingers is webbed a little higher than normal.
My thing.
I still don't understand why you never got that fixed.
Cris laughs...then suddenly stops. cris She's here.
He walks to the door and opens it to discover Ferris stan there, with her finger about to press the doorbell.
Agent Ferris, come in.
She regards Cris with appreciation.
One step ahead of the game. cRIS Always.
She enters. Tries not to be intimidated by his ability or appearance. Sees Irv, watching them. Ferris Is there some place we can speak privately?
Let's go in the kitchen. I've got a roast in the oven. IrV No, you two stay here. I'll watch the food.
Once out of Ferris' eyeline, Irv queries Cris with his ha in the shape of a gun. Cris shakes his head, then turns t Ferris - and waits for her to begin.
You're wasting your life, Cris. You have the most amazing talent, and you're running from it.
Yeah, people say I could have been a chef. Ferris Don't be cute. There's too much at stake here.
Her gravity anchors him.
Now if you say that man in the liquor store was going to shoot five people, I believe you. Why else would you kill a stranger?
Cris guards his reaction.
But no good deed goes unpunished, eh?
FERRIS (cont'd) And that's how it's going to be in this world. People will either hate you or want to exploit you.
Everyone but you, of course.
I can fix your legal problems. More importantly, I can give you a chance to use your gift.
Trust me, it's better if I don't. It's better if I just mind my own business.
Ferris looks at him, disapproving.
I'll be honest with you, Cris. That's not an option. Your country needs you. And if we don't grab you, somebody else will.
Nobody's grabbed me yet. Ferris You're up against more powerful forces now.
She lets that sink in.
I'd like you to come with me for some testing. Would you be willing to do that?
Cris's expression grows dark. He looks at Ferris accusing then BOLTS away, toward the KITCHEN.
Where are you going?
Cris covers his eyes and dives to the floor as STUN GRENA shatter windows and explode with a FLASH.
(temporarily blinded) Shit! Cavanaugh!
Gas grenades follow.

Cris scrambles to his feet as a NEVADA POLICE SWAT TEAM bursts through windows and doors, wearing gas masks and goggles, scanning with laser-guided rifles. They find Cri dashing for the back door. Open fire. Cris tumbles, dodges a few bullets, then takes a hit in t shoulder, the back, the leg. Staggers forward. Absorbs do of bullets. Falls. Lies there. Dying. Cavanaugh steps up to deliver the final shot.
INT. Irv's house / living room - an hour AGO
In that case, you've gotta leave the country.
I know, I know, I've got the place picked out. But there's something I've gotta do first.
What?
Cris doesn't answer. His gaze is distant.
Cris?
Cris focuses.
I have to go.
You just got here.
I know, but they're coming for me.
Cris takes the pack of cash he got from Guy, pulls out mo than half the bills, and sets them on a table.
This is for nurses and stuff, to make things a little easier.
You're gonna need it.
Cris shakes his head and embraces Irv. CrIS You're the only one I could trust. Ever.
They're both choked up.
I don't suppose you've discovered any last minute escape for me?
I looked, Irv, I really did. I went down every path, every treatment. Sometimes there's just no...
It's okay. It's okay...Now I can relax.

A last look. Ext. irv's street - dAY Cris' approaches his parked Camaro with his key out. CAVANAUGH and SIX TROOPERS spring from hiding, guns train on him. Camera pans to cris In Irv's back yard, watching this scene. Ext. ALLEY BEHIND IRV'S HOUSE - DAY A State Trooper keeps watch, smoking. When he steps on th butt, Cris enters the frame in the background. When the Trooper turns to a wall to piss, Cris crosses the alley, unseen. When Cris passes out of frame, the Trooper finish unaware of what he has missed.

Ext. outskirts of vegas - night A Route 66-vintage highway with stop lights and tawdry commercial development. Cris stands on the shoulder, thum a ride. Cars and trucks pass without stopping. FAST FOWARD through endless traffic until an OLD CHEVROLE pulls over. Cris checks his watch. It's 8:23.
Chris checks his watch. It's 7:57. Cris (to himself) Twenty-four minutes.

He looks around. Sees a donut shop. Heads toward it. INT. Irv's house - night Cavanaugh's State Troopers, guns drawn, are searching the place on a hair-trigger, ready to blow away anything that moves.
I need him alive, Cavanaugh. Even if he resists.
Yes, ma'am.
She points to Cavanaugh's troopers.
Tell them.
As Cavanaugh grudingly walks off to deliver the message, approaches Ferris. Irv You'll never catch him. He knows what you're gonna do to him.
That's very helpful information.
She walks off, leaving Irv to regret he opened his mouth.
INT. donut shop - night Cris steps in. Goes to the counter. CrIS Medium coffee, black, and a glazed.

As he waits, he sees a vague REFLECTION in the GLASS DISP CASE: a SQUARE CROSS, coming into focus. Puzzled, Cris looks up and around to see the object that' being reflected. He can't find it. Cris turns back to the display case, but the reflection is gone. The DONUT GIRL gives him his order.
